issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

fields.summary: touchEnabled:false doesn't work on Android/Google map.

comments.body: Thanks for your report! The Platform team will set the priority on this bug.

This is an annoying bug. Makes it impossible to use maps in scrollviews. Has anybody found a workaround?
It seems zIndex is also not working on mapViews, so you can't just add an untouchable layer to the map.

Any update on this?  I can still replicate the bug with sdk 4.0.0.GA.

A possible workaround is to put the map view inside a layout similar to the following:

{code}
<View id="container">
  <MapView ... />
  <View id="overlay" />
</View>
{code}

Ciao,
Matteo
